name: acesulfame k
comment: Artificial sweetener with potential health concerns. Chemically produced with minimal environmental impact.

name: agave syrup
comment: High in fructose, can spike blood sugar. Water-intensive crop production.

name: anchovy
comment: Rich in omega-3 fatty acids and protein. Small fish with sustainable population.

name: annatto
comment: Natural food coloring from seeds. Generally safe with minimal environmental impact.

name: apple
comment: High in fiber, vitamins, and antioxidants. Relatively sustainable fruit crop.

name: aspartame
comment: Artificial sweetener with ongoing safety debates. Chemically produced with minimal environmental impact.

name: avocado
comment: Rich in healthy fats and nutrients. Extremely water-intensive and high transport emissions.

name: baking soda
comment: Sodium bicarbonate, generally safe for consumption. Mined mineral with low environmental impact.

name: banana
comment: High in potassium and natural sugars. Imported tropical fruit with moderate environmental impact.

name: barley
comment: Whole grain rich in fiber and nutrients. Sustainable cereal crop.

name: bay leaf
comment: Aromatic herb with antioxidant properties. Sustainable perennial crop.

name: beef
comment: High in protein but also saturated fat. Major contributor to greenhouse gas emissions and deforestation.

name: beet juice powder
comment: Natural colorant rich in nitrates and antioxidants. Sustainable root vegetable.

name: benzoic acid
comment: Preservative that may cause allergic reactions in sensitive individuals. Chemically produced.

name: beta-carotene
comment: Vitamin A precursor and antioxidant. Can be naturally derived or synthetically produced.

name: bha
comment: Antioxidant preservative with potential health concerns. Synthetic chemical compound.

name: bht
comment: Antioxidant preservative with potential health concerns. Synthetic chemical compound.

comment: High in protein and fiber. Nitrogen-fixing legume that improves soil.

name: blue 1
comment: Synthetic food dye linked to hyperactivity in children. Chemically produced.

name: broccoli
comment: Nutrient-dense cruciferous vegetable. Sustainable crop with good nutrition profile.

comment: Whole grain with fiber and nutrients. Water-intensive crop with high methane emissions.

name: bulgur
comment: Whole grain wheat product rich in fiber. Sustainable cereal processing.

name: butter

name: cacao

name: calcium propionate

name: caramel color

name: carrot
comment: High in beta-carotene and fiber. Sustainable root vegetable.

name: chicken
comment: Lean protein source. Lower environmental impact than beef but still significant.

comment: High in protein and fiber. Nitrogen-fixing legume that improves soil.

name: chlorophyllin
comment: Natural green pigment with potential health benefits. Derived from plants.

comment: Spice with antioxidant and anti-inflammatory properties. Sustainable tree bark harvest.

comment: Spice with antioxidant and digestive properties. Sustainable annual crop.

name: curcumin

comment: Complete protein source with essential nutrients. Moderate environmental impact.

name: egg yolk

name: ghee
